title: @Riot quick question about buying your Marvel comics
body:
Does Marvel look more at the graphic novel/tradeback metric of success or how many digital single issues it sold online? I want to know the best way to support you guys. If it’s better to buy the physical version or pay through comiXology. 

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

replies.body:
We want to know what’s best for you!  
 
With this first run, universe will have free versions.

The paid versions on Comicology will have a TON of extra content.  Concept art,  character designs, storyboards/thumbs, scripts, glossary of terms, frelordian culture stuff, and possibly even a very long short story.  

The physical book will include all the extras from comiicology plus possibly even more bonus content.

Soooo...   It’s really a question of how much u personally want to pay, how long you wanna wait, and how much u care about bonus content etc...

I donno.  
I ussually skip these sorts of production meeting (to get more writing time)

The GOAL with marvel is for both organizations to use their various expertise to do same day, global releases of all products.  —It’s possible we won’t succeed with every territory, with everyone of these first books. But a lot of people are trying to make that work.

I wish you monetized it differently, perhaps by selling concept art books, and released the free comics sooner.  Whoever doesn’t buy a comic would have it spoiled for them by whoever does, either directly or by discussion of its revelations.  These comics cannot create the community-wide moments of “Woah!” and chatter that make League’s lore so powerful.

Uh no.  I think you misunderstand.  For this first year.  Comicology and universe are at the same time.

The collected physical book is after
So, let me get this straight.  For this first year, the comics will be published online and in print simultaneously.  Thereafter, comics will be published online first and _later_ in print?

The opposite.   

This year:
 Online comics first.  (Avail free or as a paid online version with bonus content) 
Then 6 months from now a single physical collection of the story + bonus content as a bigish book. 


Next year:
Paid first
Avail as comic floppy-books in shops, and online (paid versions only)

Six months later (18 months from now)
 a physical collection of the story and bonus material. (Paid)
While we begin releasing of free versions of the comics online.
Thanks so much!  I was very confused.  I can only hope this year’s schedule pays for the comics well enough to keep releasing them for free online simultaneously. :P

For this year, simultaneous digital release on Comixology and Universe, physical release for a full volume later.
For next year, it will be Comixology first, then Universe 6 months later for each issue, and physical collection of a full volume released later.
Do you know roughly how much the physical comic will cost? Never been a comic buyer so I'm not very familiar with the pricing

Collected books are usually 12-15 bucks depending on how many books are in, omnibuses, which I assume would be the entire comic series in this context, would be around 40-60 dollars and individual issues are usually 3-6 bucks, sometimes cheaper if used

It entirely depends on how many issues the tradeback collects and if it has any bonus content. For Ashe it will collect 6 issues (I’m assuming since it’s monthly release first comic in dec and last comic in May) and typically those sell for around 20-25 dollars depending on how many bonus content there is. 100% speculation though.

Thank you for answering. So what I gather from this is it doesn’t really matter if it’s digital or paperback form to Marvel but paperback still has a bit more. I prefer tradebacks as I like holding comics and go over the art covers in my hand.
